1: %% @doc Common Test suite for router_result_consumer
    2: -module(router_result_consumer_SUITE).
    3: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
    4: %% Note: this suite does not use records/macros from beamline_router.hrl; remove include to avoid compile-time path issues.
    5: 
    6: -export([all/0, init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1]).
    7: -export([
    8:     test_result_parsing/1,
    9:     test_result_correlation/1,
   10:     test_usage_emission/1,
   11:     test_result_validation/1,
   12:     test_malformed_json/1,
   13:     test_missing_fields/1
   14: ]).
   15: 
   16: %% Helper functions for bounded waits
   17: -export([
   18:     wait_for_app_start/2,
   19:     wait_for_meck_call/4,
   20:     wait_for_no_meck_call/4
   21: ]).
   22: 
   23: all() ->
   24:     [
   25:         test_result_parsing,
   26:         test_result_correlation,
   27:         test_usage_emission,
   28:         test_result_validation,
   29:         test_malformed_json,
   30:         test_missing_fields
   31:     ].
   32: 
   33: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   34:     _ = application:load(beamline_router),
   35:     ok = application:set_env(beamline_router, grpc_port, 0),
   36:     ok = application:set_env(beamline_router, grpc_enabled, false),
   37:     ok = application:set_env(beamline_router, nats_mode, mock),
   38:     ok = application:set_env(beamline_router, result_subject, <<"caf.exec.result.v1">>),
   39:     ok = application:set_env(beamline_router, usage_subject, <<"beamline.usage.v1.metered">>),
   40:     case application:ensure_all_started(beamline_router) of
   41:         {ok, _} ->
   42:             %% Wait for router_result_consumer to be ready (bounded wait)
   43:             wait_for_app_start(router_result_consumer, 1000),
   44:             Config;
   45:         Error ->
   46:             ct:fail("Failed to start beamline_router: ~p", [Error])
   47:     end.
   48: 
   49: end_per_suite(Config) ->
   50:     application:stop(beamline_router),
   51:     Config.
   52: 
   53: %% @doc Wait for application process to be ready (bounded polling)
   54: wait_for_app_start(ProcessName, MaxWaitMs) ->
   55:     wait_for_app_start(ProcessName, MaxWaitMs, 10).
   56: 
   57: wait_for_app_start(ProcessName, MaxWaitMs, IntervalMs) when MaxWaitMs > 0 ->
   58:     case whereis(ProcessName) of
   59:         undefined ->
   60:             timer:sleep(IntervalMs),
   61:             wait_for_app_start(ProcessName, MaxWaitMs - IntervalMs, IntervalMs);
   62:         Pid when is_pid(Pid) ->
   63:             %% Process exists, verify it's alive
   64:             case is_process_alive(Pid) of
   65:                 true -> ok;
   66:                 false ->
   67:                     timer:sleep(IntervalMs),
   68:                     wait_for_app_start(ProcessName, MaxWaitMs - IntervalMs, IntervalMs)
   69:             end
   70:     end;
   71: wait_for_app_start(ProcessName, _MaxWaitMs, _IntervalMs) ->
   72:     ct:fail("Timeout waiting for ~p to start", [ProcessName]).
   73: 
   74: %% @doc Wait for meck function to be called (bounded polling)
   75: %% Args can be a list or '_' for any arguments
   76: wait_for_meck_call(Module, Function, Args, MaxWaitMs) ->
   77:     wait_for_meck_call(Module, Function, Args, MaxWaitMs, 10).
   78: 
   79: wait_for_meck_call(Module, Function, Args, MaxWaitMs, IntervalMs) when MaxWaitMs > 0 ->
   80:     %% Check if function was called with matching arguments
   81:     case Args of
   82:         '_' ->
   83:             %% Check if function was called with any arguments
   84:             case meck:called(Module, Function, '_') of
   85:                 true -> ok;
   86:                 false ->
   87:                     timer:sleep(IntervalMs),
   88:                     wait_for_meck_call(Module, Function, Args, MaxWaitMs - IntervalMs, IntervalMs)
   89:             end;
   90:         _ when is_list(Args) ->
   91:             %% Check if function was called with specific arguments
   92:             case meck:called(Module, Function, Args) of
   93:                 true -> ok;
   94:                 false ->
   95:                     timer:sleep(IntervalMs),
   96:                     wait_for_meck_call(Module, Function, Args, MaxWaitMs - IntervalMs, IntervalMs)
   97:             end
   98:     end;
   99: wait_for_meck_call(Module, Function, Args, _MaxWaitMs, _IntervalMs) ->
  100:     ct:fail("Timeout waiting for ~p:~p/~p to be called", [Module, Function, length(Args)]).
  101: 
  102: %% @doc Wait and verify that meck function was NOT called (bounded polling)
  103: %% Args can be a list or '_' for any arguments
  104: wait_for_no_meck_call(Module, Function, Args, MaxWaitMs) ->
  105:     wait_for_no_meck_call(Module, Function, Args, MaxWaitMs, 10).
  106: 
  107: wait_for_no_meck_call(Module, Function, Args, MaxWaitMs, IntervalMs) when MaxWaitMs > 0 ->
  108:     %% Check if function was called with matching arguments
  109:     case Args of
  110:         '_' ->
  111:             %% Check if function was called with any arguments
  112:             case meck:called(Module, Function, '_') of
  113:                 true ->
  114:                     N = meck:num_calls(Module, Function, '_'),
  115:                     ct:fail("Unexpected call to ~p:~p (called ~p times)", [Module, Function, N]);
  116:                 false ->
  117:                     timer:sleep(IntervalMs),
  118:                     wait_for_no_meck_call(Module, Function, Args, MaxWaitMs - IntervalMs, IntervalMs)
  119:             end;
  120:         _ when is_list(Args) ->
  121:             %% Check if function was called with specific arguments
  122:             case meck:called(Module, Function, Args) of
  123:                 true ->
  124:                     ct:fail("Unexpected call to ~p:~p/~p", [Module, Function, length(Args)]);
  125:                 false ->
  126:                     timer:sleep(IntervalMs),
  127:                     wait_for_no_meck_call(Module, Function, Args, MaxWaitMs - IntervalMs, IntervalMs)
  128:             end
  129:     end;
  130: wait_for_no_meck_call(_Module, _Function, _Args, _MaxWaitMs, _IntervalMs) ->
  131:     %% Timeout reached, function was not called (expected)
  132:     ok.
  133: 
  134: %% Test: Parse valid ExecResult
  135: test_result_parsing(_Config) ->
  136:     Result = #{
  137:         <<"assignment_id">> => <<"assign-123">>,
  138:         <<"request_id">> => <<"req-456">>,
  139:         <<"status">> => <<"success">>,
  140:         <<"provider_id">> => <<"openai:gpt-4o">>,
  141:         <<"job">> => #{<<"type">> => <<"text.generate">>},
  142:         <<"latency_ms">> => 850,
  143:         <<"cost">> => 0.012,
  144:         <<"trace_id">> => <<"tr-789">>,
  145:         <<"tenant_id">> => <<"acme">>,
  146:         <<"timestamp">> => erlang:system_time(millisecond)
  147:     },
  148:     ResultJson = jsx:encode(Result),
  149:     
  150:     %% Mock NATS to capture usage event
  151:     meck:new(router_nats, [passthrough]),
  152:     meck:expect(router_nats, publish, fun(_Subject, _Payload) -> ok end),
  153:     
  154:     %% Process result (simulate message handling)
  155:     router_result_consumer:handle_info({nats_message, <<"caf.exec.result.v1">>, ResultJson}, #{}),
  156:     
  157:     %% Verify usage event was published (bounded wait)
  158:     wait_for_meck_call(router_nats, publish, '_', 1000),
  159:     meck:unload(router_nats),
  160:     ok.
  161: 
  162: %% Test: Correlation by assignment_id/request_id
  163: test_result_correlation(_Config) ->
  164:     AssignmentId = <<"assign-correlate">>,
  165:     RequestId = <<"req-correlate">>,
  166:     Result = #{
  167:         <<"assignment_id">> => AssignmentId,
  168:         <<"request_id">> => RequestId,
  169:         <<"status">> => <<"success">>,
  170:         <<"provider_id">> => <<"openai:gpt-4o">>,
  171:         <<"job">> => #{<<"type">> => <<"text.generate">>},
  172:         <<"latency_ms">> => 850,
  173:         <<"cost">> => 0.012
  174:     },
  175:     ResultJson = jsx:encode(Result),
  176:     
  177:     meck:new(router_nats, [passthrough]),
  178:     meck:expect(router_nats, publish, fun(_Subject, Payload) ->
  179:         UsageMap = jsx:decode(Payload, [return_maps]),
  180:         %% Verify correlation IDs are present
  181:         maps:get(<<"assignment_id">>, UsageMap) =:= AssignmentId,
  182:         maps:get(<<"request_id">>, UsageMap) =:= RequestId,
  183:         ok
  184:     end),
  185:     
  186:     router_result_consumer:handle_info({nats_message, <<"caf.exec.result.v1">>, ResultJson}, #{}),
  187:     
  188:     %% Verify usage event was published with correct correlation IDs (bounded wait)
  189:     wait_for_meck_call(router_nats, publish, '_', 1000),
  190:     
  191:     %% Verify the call was made with correct arguments
  192:     case meck:history(router_nats) of
  193:         [{_Pid, {router_nats, publish, [Subject, Payload]}, _Result}] ->
  194:             UsageMap = jsx:decode(Payload, [return_maps]),
  195:             %% Verify correlation IDs are present
  196:             AssignmentId =:= maps:get(<<"assignment_id">>, UsageMap, undefined),
  197:             RequestId =:= maps:get(<<"request_id">>, UsageMap, undefined);
  198:         _ ->
  199:             ct:fail("Expected exactly one call to router_nats:publish, got: ~p", [meck:history(router_nats)])
  200:     end,
  201:     
  202:     meck:unload(router_nats),
  203:     ok.
  204: 
  205: %% Test: Usage event emission
  206: test_usage_emission(_Config) ->
  207:     Result = #{
  208:         <<"assignment_id">> => <<"assign-usage">>,
  209:         <<"request_id">> => <<"req-usage">>,
  210:         <<"status">> => <<"success">>,
  211:         <<"provider_id">> => <<"openai:gpt-4o">>,
  212:         <<"job">> => #{<<"type">> => <<"text.generate">>},
  213:         <<"latency_ms">> => 850,
  214:         <<"cost">> => 0.012,
  215:         <<"tenant_id">> => <<"acme">>
  216:     },
  217:     ResultJson = jsx:encode(Result),
  218:     
  219:     meck:new(router_nats, [passthrough]),
  220:     meck:expect(router_nats, publish, fun(Subject, Payload) ->
  221:         case Subject of
  222:             <<"beamline.usage.v1.metered">> ->
  223:                 UsageMap = jsx:decode(Payload, [return_maps]),
  224:                 %% Verify usage message structure
  225:                 maps:is_key(<<"version">>, UsageMap) andalso
  226:                 maps:is_key(<<"tenant_id">>, UsageMap) andalso
  227:                 maps:is_key(<<"provider_id">>, UsageMap) andalso
  228:                 maps:is_key(<<"event_type">>, UsageMap) andalso
  229:                 maps:is_key(<<"latency_ms">>, UsageMap) andalso
  230:                 maps:is_key(<<"cost">>, UsageMap) andalso
  231:                 maps:is_key(<<"status">>, UsageMap);
  232:             _ ->
  233:                 false
  234:         end,
  235:         ok
  236:     end),
  237:     
  238:     router_result_consumer:handle_info({nats_message, <<"caf.exec.result.v1">>, ResultJson}, #{}),
  239:     
  240:     %% Verify usage event was published with correct structure (bounded wait)
  241:     wait_for_meck_call(router_nats, publish, '_', 1000),
  242:     
  243:     %% Verify the call was made with correct subject and payload structure
  244:     case meck:history(router_nats) of
  245:         [{_Pid, {router_nats, publish, [Subject, Payload]}, _Result}] ->
  246:             case Subject of
  247:                 <<"beamline.usage.v1.metered">> ->
  248:                     UsageMap = jsx:decode(Payload, [return_maps]),
  249:                     %% Verify usage message structure
  250:                     maps:is_key(<<"version">>, UsageMap) andalso
  251:                     maps:is_key(<<"tenant_id">>, UsageMap) andalso
  252:                     maps:is_key(<<"provider_id">>, UsageMap) andalso
  253:                     maps:is_key(<<"event_type">>, UsageMap) andalso
  254:                     maps:is_key(<<"latency_ms">>, UsageMap) andalso
  255:                     maps:is_key(<<"cost">>, UsageMap) andalso
  256:                     maps:is_key(<<"status">>, UsageMap);
  257:                 _ ->
  258:                     ct:fail("Expected subject 'beamline.usage.v1.metered', got: ~p", [Subject])
  259:             end;
  260:         _ ->
  261:             ct:fail("Expected exactly one call to router_nats:publish, got: ~p", [meck:history(router_nats)])
  262:     end,
  263:     
  264:     meck:unload(router_nats),
  265:     ok.
  266: 
  267: %% Test: Result validation
  268: test_result_validation(_Config) ->
  269:     %% Test missing assignment_id and request_id
  270:     Result1 = #{
  271:         <<"status">> => <<"success">>
  272:     },
  273:     Result1Json = jsx:encode(Result1),
  274:     
  275:     meck:new(router_nats, [passthrough]),
  276:     meck:expect(router_nats, publish, fun(_Subject, _Payload) -> ok end),
  277:     
  278:     router_result_consumer:handle_info({nats_message, <<"caf.exec.result.v1">>, Result1Json}, #{}),
  279:     
  280:     %% Should not publish usage (validation failed) - use bounded wait to verify
  281:     wait_for_no_meck_call(router_nats, publish, '_', 200),
  282:     meck:unload(router_nats),
  283:     ok.
  284: 
  285: %% Test: Malformed JSON
  286: test_malformed_json(_Config) ->
  287:     MalformedJson = <<"{invalid json}">>,
  288:     
  289:     meck:new(router_nats, [passthrough]),
  290:     meck:expect(router_nats, publish, fun(_Subject, _Payload) -> ok end),
  291:     
  292:     gen_server:call(router_result_consumer, {test_message, <<"caf.exec.result.v1">>, MalformedJson}),
  293:     
  294:     %% Should not crash, should log error - use bounded wait to verify no publication
  295:     wait_for_no_meck_call(router_nats, publish, '_', 200),
  296:     meck:unload(router_nats),
  297:     ok.
  298: 
  299: %% Test: Missing required fields
  300: test_missing_fields(_Config) ->
  301:     Result = #{
  302:         <<"assignment_id">> => <<"assign-missing">>,
  303:         <<"request_id">> => <<"req-missing">>
  304:         %% Missing status
  305:     },
  306:     ResultJson = jsx:encode(Result),
  307:     
  308:     meck:new(router_nats, [passthrough]),
  309:     meck:expect(router_nats, publish, fun(_Subject, _Payload) -> ok end),
  310:     
  311:     gen_server:call(router_result_consumer, {test_message, <<"caf.exec.result.v1">>, ResultJson}),
  312:     
  313:     %% Should not publish usage (validation failed) - use bounded wait to verify
  314:     wait_for_no_meck_call(router_nats, publish, ['_', '_'], 200),
  315:     meck:unload(router_nats),
  316:     ok.
